definitions.definition: a statement showing that two amounts or values are equal, for example 2x + y = 54

examples.text: the numbers on the right-hand side of the equation
the equation for a straight line
The ideal gas equation is derived from this model.
This can be shown by a simple equation.
the range of values of ξ which would satisfy this equation

definitions.definition: the act of making something equal or considering something as equal (= of equating them)

examples.text: The equation of wealth with happiness can be dangerous.

definitions.definition: a problem or situation in which several things must be considered and dealt with

examples.text: When children **enter the equation**, further tensions may arise within a marriage.
The availability of public transport is also **part of the equation**.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin aequatio(n-), from aequare ‘make equal’, from aequus ‘even, level, equal’.
